data.title: Foster an animal
data.meta_description: Thank you for your interest in becoming a PAWS foster parent volunteer. PAWS saves more than 2,000 animals each year through our Foster Care Program. Foster parents provide temporary care for cats, kittens, dogs and puppies in their own King County and greater-Snohomish area homes. Some animals need as little as two weeks of care, […]
data.text:
Questions on becoming a foster family?

Visit our Foster Care Program FAQs here. If you still have questions, we can help you decide if fostering is right for you and your family.

Call 425.787.2500 x822 or email [email protected].

What is foster care?

Foster homes provide a temporary safe place for some of our most vulnerable cats and dogs to rest and heal. Foster families also care for kittens and puppies until they are old and big enough for adoption.

learn more

Current foster needs

PAWS’ Foster Care Program is constantly growing and so is our need for families who can provide specialized care. Here is a list of our current needs and how you can help.

Learn more
